verses.text: 隨後，耶穌被聖靈帶到曠野，受魔鬼的試探。

words.note: A theological term referring to the third person of the Trinity.
Often refers to the desert regions of the ancient Near East in the Bible.

verses.text: 耶穌禁食了四十晝夜，就餓了，
試探者前來對他說：「你若是 神的兒子，就吩咐這些石頭變成食物吧！」

words.note: The elevated character indicates reverence in some Chinese Bibles.

verses.text: 耶穌回答：「經上記著：『人活著，不是單靠食物，更要靠 神口裡所出的一切話。』」

words.note: The elevated character indicates reverence in some Chinese Bibles.

words.definition: in the mouth, from the mouth

verses.text: 隨後，魔鬼帶耶穌進了聖城，使他站在殿的最高處，

words.note: Refers to Jerusalem in biblical context.
Specifically refers to the Temple in Jerusalem.

verses.text: 對他說：「你若是 神的兒子，就跳下去吧！因為經上記著：『 神為了你，會吩咐自己的使者用手托住你，免得你的腳碰到石頭。』」

words.note: The empty space before 神 is a reverential space.
Indicates suggestion or command.
The empty space before 神 is a reverential space.
Often refers to angels in biblical context.

verses.text: 耶穌對他說：「經上又記著：『不可試探主你的 神。』」

words.note: Often used in the context of tempting God or Satan.
The empty space before 神 is a reverential space.

verses.text: 最後，魔鬼帶耶穌上了一座極高的山，把世界各國和各國的榮華都指給他看。

words.note: Often refers to worldly glory and prosperity, especially in religious texts.

verses.text: 並且對他說：「你只要跪下來拜我，我就把這一切都給你。」

words.note: In this context, specifically 'to worship'.

verses.text: 但耶穌說：「撒但，走開！經上記著：『當拜主你的 神，單要事奉他。』」

words.note: In this context, specifically 'to worship'.
The empty space before 神 is a reverential space.
Emphasizes exclusivity, 'only' in the context of a command.
Specifically refers to serving a superior or deity.

verses.text: 於是魔鬼離開了耶穌，有天使前來服事他。

words.note: Lit. 'demon ghost'
Lit. 'heavenly messenger'
Often used in religious contexts for service.

verses.text: 耶穌聽見約翰被捕，就往加利利去。
verses.heading: Preaching in Galilee

verses.text: 他又離開拿撒勒，往西布倫和拿弗他利境內近海的迦百農去，住在那裡，
為了要應驗以賽亞先知所說的：

words.definition: in order to, for the sake of
will, want to, be about to

words.note: Commonly used for prophecy fulfillment.
Lit. 'one who knows first'
Indicates the object of the following verb.

verses.text: 「西布倫地、拿弗他利地，沿海之路，約旦河外，外族人的加利利啊！

words.note: Similar to 'de' but more formal/literary.
Lit. 'Jordan River'
Lit. 'outside race people', often translated as 'Gentiles' in biblical context.
Expresses exclamation or affirmation.

verses.text: 住在黑暗中的人民，看見了大光；死亡幽暗之地的居民，有光照亮他們。」

words.note: Often used with '在...中' to mean 'in the midst of'.
Indicates completion of an action or change of state.
Often refers to divine light or revelation in a biblical context.
Emphasizes a sense of deep, foreboding darkness.
A somewhat classical construction, common in older and biblical texts.

verses.text: 從那時起，耶穌就開始傳道，說：「天國近了，你們應當悔改。」

words.note: Used with '從...起' to mean 'starting from...'
Lit. 'transmit the Way/Truth'.
Indicates that a new situation has arisen or is about to occur.
Lit. 'regret and change'.

verses.text: 耶穌在加利利海邊行走的時候，看見兄弟二人，就是名叫彼得的西門和他的弟弟安得烈，正在把網撒到海裡去；他們是漁夫。

words.note: Used to denote 'beside' or 'on the edge of' a place.
Connects a preceding clause to form an adverbial phrase of time.
Combined with '的' (的時候) to mean 'when' or 'at the time of'.
Indicates an action is ongoing.
Used to bring the object before the verb for emphasis or clarity.
Indicates direction or result of an action.
Often combined with location nouns to mean 'in' or 'inside'.
Indicates movement away from the speaker/subject.

verses.heading: The Call of the Disciples

verses.text: 耶穌就對他們說：「來跟從我，我要使你們作得人的漁夫。」

words.note: Introduces the recipient of an action or speech.
Translates to 'fishers of men' when combined with '漁夫'.

verses.text: 他們立刻撇下網，跟從了他。

words.note: Indicates completion of an action.

verses.text: 耶穌又往前走，看見另一對兄弟，就是西庇太的兒子雅各和約翰，正和父親西庇太在船上整理魚網，他就呼召他們。

words.note: Commonly used in religious contexts for divine calling.

verses.text: 他們立刻離了船，別了父親，跟從了耶穌。
耶穌走遍加利利，在各會堂裡教導人，宣揚天國的福音，醫治民間各種疾病、各種病症。

words.note: Lit. 'blessed news'.

verses.heading: Jesus’ Healing Ministry

verses.text: 他的名聲傳遍了敘利亞全地，人們就把一切患病的，就是患各種疾病、疼痛、鬼附、癲癇、癱瘓的，都帶到他面前，他就醫好他們。

words.note: Introduces the object before the verb.
Turns a verb/adj into a noun phrase (e.g., 'those who are sick').
Turns a verb/adj into a noun phrase.

verses.text: 於是有許多人從加利利、低加波利、耶路撒冷、猶太和約旦河東來跟從耶穌。

words.note: 約旦 (Jordan) + 河 (river)
